analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang; lce'i skye mched dang / ro'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang / reg bya'i skye mched de /
translated: the eye sense-sphere, the form sense-sphere, the ear sense-sphere, the sound sense-sphere, the nose sense-sphere, the smell sense-sphere, the tongue sense-sphere, the taste sense-sphere, the body sense-sphere, and the tangible sense-sphere.

original: skye mched gzugs can bcu po de dag la rtog par byed do //üîΩbdag gi mig gi skye mched la'ang brten /
analyzed: skye mched gzugs can bcu po de dag la rtog par byed do // bdag gi mig gi skye mched la'ang brten /
translated: He considers these ten material sense-spheres.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched la'ang brten nas 'du shes su ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩmig la'ang brten /üîΩgzugs la'ang brten nas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched la'ang brten nas 'du shes su ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / mig la'ang brten / gzugs la'ang brten nas /
translated: ‚ÄúHow does perception arise in dependence on the eye sense-sphere and the form sense-sphere?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar mthong ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar mthong ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHe sees that the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa /
translated: From the coming together of the three, contact arises.

original: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From contact, feeling, perception, and volition arise together.

original: de la tshor ba gang yin pa de ni myong ba'o //
analyzed: de la tshor ba gang yin pa de ni myong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere, feeling is experience.

original: sems pa gang yin pa de ni sems par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa gang yin pa de ni sems par byed pa'o //
translated: The mind that is the agent of intention is the intention itself.

original: de la 'du shes gang yin pa de ni shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'du shes gang yin pa de ni shes pa yin te /
translated: The discernment that is the agent of discernment is the discernment itself.

original: 'di ltar gzugs 'di ni ring po /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs 'di ni ring po /
translated: This form is long.

original: gzugs 'di @236b ni thung ngu /üîΩgzugs 'di ni sdug pa /
analyzed: gzugs 'di @236b ni thung ngu / gzugs 'di ni sdug pa /
translated: This form is short.üîΩThis form is beautiful.

original: gzugs 'di ni mi sdug pa /üîΩgzugs 'di ni bstan du yod pa /
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni mi sdug pa / gzugs 'di ni bstan du yod pa /
translated: This form is ugly.üîΩThis form is visible.

original: gzugs 'di thogs pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: gzugs 'di thogs pa dang bcas pa /
translated: This form is resistant.

original: gzugs 'di ni bstan du med pa /
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni bstan du med pa /
translated: This form is invisible.üîΩThis form is nonresistant.

original: gzugs 'di ni thogs pa med pa zhes rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i bar rnam pa bcu gcig po 'di ni 'du shes kyi gzugs su rnam par dbye ste /
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni thogs pa med pa zhes rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i bar rnam pa bcu gcig po 'di ni 'du shes kyi gzugs su rnam par dbye ste /
translated: This is the classification of form as the eleven types of discernment, up to and including noninformative form.

original: de ltar gsum 'dus pa las reg pa skye'o //üîΩde reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar gsum 'dus pa las reg pa skye'o // de reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung ste /
translated: In this way, contact arises from the coming together of the three.üîΩFeeling, discernment, and intention arise together with that contact.

original: de la mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa myong ba'i don ni tshor ba'i don no //
analyzed: de la mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa myong ba'i don ni tshor ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning of experience in relation to feeling, discernment, and intention that arise from contact with the eye is the meaning of feeling.

original: 'du shes kyi don ni tshor ba'i tshe yang dag par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi don ni tshor ba'i tshe yang dag par shes pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of perception is the correct knowledge of feeling.

original: chos 'di dag la yid 'jug pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra zhing ngo bo nyid mi 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: chos 'di dag la yid 'jug pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra zhing ngo bo nyid mi 'dra ba yin te /
translated: These dharmas are different in characteristics and different in natures, because they are the causes of the arising of the mind.

original: dper na / sa chen po bcu'i chos lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na / sa chen po bcu'i chos lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the dharmas of the ten great elements.

original: sems pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'ang de bzhin de /
analyzed: sems pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'ang de bzhin de /
translated: The characteristics of volition are also like this.

original: rnam pa rtog pas yid la byed pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dran pa dang; tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin de dag ni dmigs pa gcig la mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa rtog pas yid la byed pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dran pa dang; tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin de dag ni dmigs pa gcig la mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: The mental activities of conceptualization, investigation, memory, feeling, perception, volition, contact, striving, and concentration are different in characteristics with regard to the same object.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba'i mtshan nyid kyang mi 'dra zhing de bzhin du 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid kyang mi 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba'i mtshan nyid kyang mi 'dra zhing de bzhin du 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid kyang mi 'dra ba yin te /
translated: In the same way, the characteristics of feeling are different, and in the same way, the characteristics of perception are different.

original: dper na / nyi ma'i gzhi gcig yin kyang 'od kyi ngo bo tha dad pa de bzhin du tshor ba'i @237a *//
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma'i gzhi gcig yin kyang 'od kyi ngo bo tha dad pa de bzhin du tshor ba'i @237a *//
translated: For example, it is like the light of the sun, which is of one foundation but of different natures. In the same way, feeling, perception, and so on are of one foundation but of different natures.

original: ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan yin la /
translated: The nature of the eye is one thing,

original: sems pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: sems pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan yin no //
translated: the nature of intention is another.

original: de mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'i de kho na nyid shes nas /
analyzed: de mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'i de kho na nyid shes nas /
translated: Having understood the reality of the feeling, perception, and intention that arise from the contact of the eye,

original: mig 'di ni gsog tu mthong /üîΩgsob tu mthong /
analyzed: mig 'di ni gsog tu mthong / gsob tu mthong /
translated: he sees the eye as hollow.üîΩHe sees it as void.

original: snying po med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: snying po med par mthong ngo //
translated: He sees it as insubstantial.

original: yang dag par mthong ba'i dge slong de ni lam gyi de kho na nyid shes nas log par lta ba spangs te /
analyzed: yang dag par mthong ba'i dge slong de ni lam gyi de kho na nyid shes nas log par lta ba spangs te /
translated: The monk who sees reality in this way, having understood the reality of the path, abandons false views.

original: de yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du btang bas de mig dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'du shes kyi gti mug rnyog pa can gyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa spong ngo //
analyzed: de yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du btang bas de mig dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'du shes kyi gti mug rnyog pa can gyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa spong ngo //
translated: Having made right view preeminent, he abandons the confusion that is the essential nature of the eye and the perceptions that arise with it.

original: sha'i gong bu'i de kho na nyid mthong ste /
analyzed: sha'i gong bu'i de kho na nyid mthong ste /
translated: He sees the reality of the mass of flesh

original: tshil dang / rnag dang / khrag dang / mchi ma'i gnas yin par rig nas /
analyzed: tshil dang / rnag dang / khrag dang / mchi ma'i gnas yin par rig nas /
translated: and, knowing it to be a repository of fat, pus, blood, and tears,

original: 'dod chags spong zhing mi rtag par rig nas rtag par mi lta ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags spong zhing mi rtag par rig nas rtag par mi lta ba yin la /
translated: he abandons desire. Knowing it to be impermanent, he does not view it as permanent.

original: rus pa'i bu ga'i nang na sha'i gong bu yod par rig nas 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rus pa'i bu ga'i nang na sha'i gong bu yod par rig nas 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: Knowing that the cavities of the bones are filled with flesh, he becomes free from desire.

original: rgyus pas sbrel bar rig cing mig gi skye mched 'di ni gcig la gcig 'brel bar rtogs te /
analyzed: rgyus pas sbrel bar rig cing mig gi skye mched 'di ni gcig la gcig 'brel bar rtogs te /
translated: He knows that the eyes are connected by sinews and that the sense source of the eyes is connected to one another.

original: 'di la snying po med cing bdag med par rig la /üîΩmdor na mig 'di ni sdug bsngal du gyur pa yin no zhes rnam par shes shing mthong nas mig gi skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro; ;de mig gi skye mched yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs shing gzugs la rnam par dpyod par
analyzed: 'di la snying po med cing bdag med par rig la / mdor na mig 'di ni sdug bsngal du gyur pa yin no zhes rnam par shes shing mthong nas mig gi skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro; ;de mig gi skye mched yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs shing gzugs la rnam par dpyod par
translated: He knows that there is no essence in this and that there is no self.üîΩIn short, he knows and sees that the eyes are suffering.üîΩIn this way, he becomes free from desire for the sense source of the eyes.

original: byed de / gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gzugs 'di sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa @237b dang; lung du ma bstan pa yongs su rtog ste /
analyzed: byed de / gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gzugs 'di sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa @237b dang; lung du ma bstan pa yongs su rtog ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHe who correctly understands the sense source of the eyes and analyzes forms will think, ‚ÄòIf I imagine that these unreal forms are attractive, unattractive, or neutral,

original: ci 'di la snying po yod dam /
analyzed: ci 'di la snying po yod dam /
translated: is there any essence to them?

original: ci gtsang ngam /
analyzed: ci gtsang ngam /
translated: Are they pure?

original: ci rtag gam /
analyzed: ci rtag gam /
translated: Are they permanent?

original: ci bde ba yod dam snyam mo //
analyzed: ci bde ba yod dam snyam mo //
translated: Are they happiness?‚Äô

original: de gzugs la lta zhing shes te /
analyzed: de gzugs la lta zhing shes te /
translated: He sees and knows forms.

original: rtog pas gzugs su mi dmigs te /
analyzed: rtog pas gzugs su mi dmigs te /
translated: He does not observe form as a conceptualization.

original: 'di la snying po med do //
analyzed: 'di la snying po med do //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no essence here.‚Äù

original: gzugs sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa 'di ni kun tu rtog pa tsam ste /
analyzed: gzugs sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa 'di ni kun tu rtog pa tsam ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAttractive and unattractive forms are mere conceptualizations.

original: 'di la sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i ngo bo ni med la sdug pa dang / khong khro ba kho nar kun tu rtog pas bzung ba'i 'jig rten 'di ni sdug pa dang / sdang bar sems so snyam mo //
analyzed: 'di la sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i ngo bo ni med la sdug pa dang / khong khro ba kho nar kun tu rtog pas bzung ba'i 'jig rten 'di ni sdug pa dang / sdang bar sems so snyam mo //
translated: There is no essence of attractiveness or unattractiveness here. But this world, which is grasped by conceptualization as attractive and unattractive, thinks in terms of attraction and aversion.‚Äù

original: de mig gi skye mched mthong nas /
analyzed: de mig gi skye mched mthong nas /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen he sees the eye-source,

original: rna ba'i skye mched la lta bar byed de /
analyzed: rna ba'i skye mched la lta bar byed de /
translated: he observes the ear-source.

original: de sgra la so sor rtog go /
analyzed: de sgra la so sor rtog go /
translated: He discerns sound.

original: sgra skyes pa dbang po'i yul la 'jug ste /
analyzed: sgra skyes pa dbang po'i yul la 'jug ste /
translated: Sound arises and engages the object of the sense-faculty.

original: des rna ba la'ang brten /
analyzed: des rna ba la'ang brten /
translated: It arises in dependence on the ear,

original: sgra la'ang brten /
analyzed: sgra la'ang brten /
translated: in dependence on sound,

original: de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa la'ang brten nas rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa la'ang brten nas rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: and in dependence on the mental activity that produces it.

original: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa /
translated: From the coming together of the three, contact arises.

original: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Feeling, conception, and volition arise together with contact.

original: de la reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa gang gis myong bar byed /
analyzed: de la reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa gang gis myong bar byed /
translated: What is it that experiences it together with contact?

original: de la reg pa dang lhan cig byung ba'i 'du shes gang gis kun tu shes par byed /
analyzed: de la reg pa dang lhan cig byung ba'i 'du shes gang gis kun tu shes par byed /
translated: What is it that perceives it together with contact?

original: reg pa dang lhan cig byung ba'i sems pa gang gis sems par byed snyam na /üîΩ'du shes ni /
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig byung ba'i sems pa gang gis sems par byed snyam na / 'du shes ni /
translated: What is it that thinks it together with contact?‚Äù

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúPerception is as follows:üîΩ‚ÄòThis is long,‚Äô and so forth.

original: 'di ni ring ngo snyam pa'i mtshan nyid do; ;sgra 'byung ba'i rkyen 'di las skyes pa'i sgra mi gsal ba dang / chung ba dang / chen por snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni ring ngo snyam pa'i mtshan nyid do; ;sgra 'byung ba'i rkyen 'di las skyes pa'i sgra mi gsal ba dang / chung ba dang / chen por snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa 'di 'byung ste /
translated: From the condition of the arising of sound, there arises an indistinct, small, or loud sound, pleasant or unpleasant.

original: de sgra byung ba de la so sor rig par byed cing yang dag par @238a *//
analyzed: de sgra byung ba de la so sor rig par byed cing yang dag par @238a *//
translated: One is aware of that arisen sound and thinks about it.

original: sems par byed la 'du shes kyis rnam par 'byed par byed /
analyzed: sems par byed la 'du shes kyis rnam par 'byed par byed /
translated: One distinguishes it with perception,üîΩand one cognizes it with mental consciousness.

original: yid kyis rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par byed cing tshor bas shes par byed la /
analyzed: yid kyis rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par byed cing tshor bas shes par byed la /
translated: One understands it with feeling,

original: som nyis rnam par dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: som nyis rnam par dpyod par byed do //
translated: and one analyzes it with doubt.

original: de rna ba'i skye mched la mngon par zhen pa na rtog par byed /üîΩrtog pa na rnam par dpyod par byed /
analyzed: de rna ba'i skye mched la mngon par zhen pa na rtog par byed / rtog pa na rnam par dpyod par byed /
translated: When they are attached to the ear sense-sphere, they conceptualize.üîΩWhen they conceptualize, they analyze.

original: rnam bar dpyod pa na so so yang dag par rig par byed de /üîΩ'di la sgra ngo bo nyid kyis snyan pa'am /
analyzed: rnam bar dpyod pa na so so yang dag par rig par byed de / 'di la sgra ngo bo nyid kyis snyan pa'am /
translated: When they analyze, they understand correctly.

original: mi snyan pa ni med do //üîΩsgra snyan pa'am /
analyzed: mi snyan pa ni med do // sgra snyan pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄòThere is no sound that is inherently pleasant or unpleasant.

original: mi snyan pa 'di ni kun tu rtog pa tsam kho na ste /
analyzed: mi snyan pa 'di ni kun tu rtog pa tsam kho na ste /
translated: This pleasant or unpleasant sound is merely a conceptual imputation.

original: sgra 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa'am /
analyzed: sgra 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa'am /
translated: This sound is not inherently permanent,

original: bde ba'am / snying po'am /
analyzed: bde ba'am / snying po'am /
translated: happy, a core,

original: bdag dang bcas pa ni med la /üîΩsgra snyan pa'am /
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa ni med la / sgra snyan pa'am /
translated: or possessing a self.

original: mi snyan pa 'di ni 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug kho na'o snyam mo //
analyzed: mi snyan pa 'di ni 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug kho na'o snyam mo //
translated: This pleasant or unpleasant sound is merely attachment, anger, or ignorance.‚Äô

original: de sgra'i skye mched la mngon par kun tu rtog pa na /
analyzed: de sgra'i skye mched la mngon par kun tu rtog pa na /
translated: When they fully conceptualize the sound sense-sphere,

original: sgra thos pa na rmongs pa med cing chags pa med la snying po med par rtogs so //
analyzed: sgra thos pa na rmongs pa med cing chags pa med la snying po med par rtogs so //
translated: when they hear a sound, they understand it to be without delusion, without attachment, and without essence.

original: de rna ba dang / sgra'i skye mched la mngon par rtog pa na /
analyzed: de rna ba dang / sgra'i skye mched la mngon par rtog pa na /
translated: When they fully conceptualize the ear and sound sense-spheres,

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la chags pa med cing 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la chags pa med cing 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob ste /
translated: He will be free from attachment and free from desire with regard to the ear consciousness.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni bdag ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni bdag ma yin zhing /
translated: The ear consciousness is not the self.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni bdag gi ma yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni bdag gi ma yin no snyam mo //
translated: The ear consciousness is not mine.

original: reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sems pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sems pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to contact, sensation, and intention.

original: yang dge slong de sna dang / dri'i skye mched la lta ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong de sna dang / dri'i skye mched la lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe monk will then observe the nose and the sense source of smells.

original: sna la'ang brten /
analyzed: sna la'ang brten /
translated: The nose consciousness arises in dependence on the nose,

original: dri la'ang brten /
analyzed: dri la'ang brten /
translated: in dependence on smells,

original: de skyed pa yid la byed pa la'ang brten nas sna'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /üîΩnye @238b ba'am /
analyzed: de skyed pa yid la byed pa la'ang brten nas sna'i rnam par shes pa skye ste / nye @238b ba'am /
translated: and in dependence on the mental activity that produces it.

original: ring ba'am / yid du 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: ring ba'am / yid du 'ong ba'am /
translated: Whether smells are near or far,

original: yid du mi 'ong ba'am /üîΩdri zhim pa'am /
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba'am / dri zhim pa'am /
translated: whether they are pleasant or unpleasant,

original: dri mi zhim pa'am /
analyzed: dri mi zhim pa'am /
translated: whether they are fragrant or malodorous,

original: rlung gis khyer te 'ongs pa'am /üîΩkhyer te mi 'ongs ba'i dri so sor snom mo //
analyzed: rlung gis khyer te 'ongs pa'am / khyer te mi 'ongs ba'i dri so sor snom mo //
translated: whether they are carried by the wind or not,üîΩthe nose will smell them individually.

original: de la sna'i skye mched la phyi rol gyi dri de sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de la sna'i skye mched la phyi rol gyi dri de sbyor bar byed de /
translated: The external smells are applied to the sense source of the nose.

original: de la gsum 'dus pa las reg pa /
analyzed: de la gsum 'dus pa las reg pa /
translated: From the coming together of the three arises contact.

original: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa 'byung ngo //
translated: perception, and volition arise together with it.

original: de la myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de la myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Among them, feeling has the characteristic of experience.

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'du shes so //
translated: Perception has the characteristic of cognition.

original: de rna ba dang / sgra'i skye mched thos nas nang gi reg pa'i mtshan nyid ni reg pa /
analyzed: de rna ba dang / sgra'i skye mched thos nas nang gi reg pa'i mtshan nyid ni reg pa /
translated: When the ear sense-sphere hears sound, the characteristic of internal contact is contact.

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'du shes /
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'du shes /
translated: The characteristic of cognition is perception.

original: de sems pa'i mtshan nyid 'du shes sems par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de sems pa'i mtshan nyid 'du shes sems par byed pa yin te /
translated: The characteristic of volition is that it causes the mind to perceive.

original: chos 'di dag ni skad cig ma gcig la dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni skad cig ma gcig la dmigs pa yin la /

analyzed: mi la gnad par byed pa'i las thob pa gang yin pa ni /

analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di la'ang myong bar 'gyur ba ni mu gsum pa yin no //
translated: Karma to be experienced in both the next life and this life is the third possibility.

original: tshe 'di la'ang myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa dang / skyes nas kyang myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa ni mu bzhi pa yin no //üîΩtshe 'di la myong bar gyur la /

analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i las gar yin zhe na /

analyzed: dper na / 'jig rten pa dag rgyal po la gnod pa byas na chad pas gcod pa ni tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba yin la /

analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: dper na / 'jig rten pa dag me dong du zhugs pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba lta bu'o //

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni tshe 'di la dge ba'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni tshe 'di la dge ba'am /

analyzed: sred pa'i gnas sna tshogs kyi bye brag @252a *//

analyzed: gis mdor na kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di'i phyogs 'di ni sems las byung ba lngar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par bya ba'i sogs su 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba gsum dag gi gnyen po gsum ma yin no //

analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung rab yang dag pa'i lam ston pa ni /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: 'dod chags la ni mi sdug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la ni mi sdug pa'o //

original: zhe sdang la ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang la ni byams pa'o //

analyzed: gti mug la ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //

original: de lus la 'dod chags skye ba na /
analyzed: de lus la 'dod chags skye ba na /
translated: When desire for the body arises,

analyzed: de lus de la dmigs nas gnas shing rnam par 'byed de / rkang pa dang / sor mo dang / mgo dang / yan lag dang / nying lag rags pa'i bar la rnam par 'byed pa ni bdag gang yin /

analyzed: bdag gi ci yin zhes de rang gi yan lag gi phyogs la rkang pa dang / sen mo lus tha dad par lta ste /

analyzed: bdag ma yin te / gang la bdag tu nga rgyal 'jug pa 'di ni /

analyzed: de 'byung ba chen po rnams rnam par 'byed de /

analyzed: rlung gi khams bdag yin nam snyam mo //
translated: Is the wind element the self?‚Äù

analyzed: de don dam par na bdag gi khams ma mthong zhing bdag gi khams mthong ba med pa na don gzhan du gyur pa ma mthong ste /

analyzed: lo ma dang / lcug ma ma gtogs par don gzhan du gyur pa med de /
translated: the leaves, and the twigs.

analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni tshal yod do // de ltar lus 'di'ang lag pa la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam 'di la kun rdzob tu 'di ni @253a *//

translated: Thus, knowing the reality of the body, one becomes free from desire for the body and free from desire for the body‚Äôs major and minor parts.

analyzed: de 'dod chags dang bral na dga' pa'i 'dod chags kyi mod las skyes pa'ang 'byung ba'i sred pas gnod pa med de /

original: de ltar 'dod chags kyi gnyen po la rab tu brtson no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags kyi gnyen po la rab tu brtson no //

analyzed: de byams pa la gnas par 'gyur te /

analyzed: lus dang bral @253b nas dam 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye'o //
translated: Having separated from the body, they are reborn in the lower existences, in the hells.

original: gang gi tshe yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du song bas gti mug dang bral bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe lus kyis legs par spyad pa dang / ngag gis legs par spyad pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa spyod pa de chos dang /

translated: But when they are free from delusion because they are preceded by right view, then they engage in physical good conduct, engage in verbal good conduct, and engage in mental good conduct.

analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid shes par 'gyur ro //

translated: For example, if the root of a tree is cut, the bark, the roots, the leaves, the branches, the flowers, the fruits, and so forth will all rot

analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa de nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
translated: YogacƒÅrins, when they abide in the observation of internal phenomena, do so by means of knowledge derived from hearing or

analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong ste / ji ltar na dge @254a *//
translated: YogƒÅcƒÅra practitioners who observe inner phenomena see with knowledge derived from hearing or with the divine eye:üîΩ‚ÄúHow do monks see with the eye in a manner that accords with reality?

analyzed: slong thog ma nyid du 'di ltar mig gis yang dag pa ji lta bu bzhin mthong zhing ji ltar na mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la byis pa so so'i skye bo kun tu chags shing rnam par chags la shin tu rmongs shig gu
translated: How do they see that childish ordinary beings are attached and strongly deluded with regard to forms that are objects of eye consciousness?‚Äù

analyzed: snyam na / de la kun tu chags pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba ni mdza' bshes mthong ba'am /

analyzed: gzugs sam / bud med dam / de las gzhan pa mthong na kun tu chags par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sred pas bslus pa'i mi ni rang gi 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pas bdag nyid la bdag nyid kun tu chags par byed de /

analyzed: de'i sred pa ni gang gis khrag 'dzag pa lta bu yin te /

original: 'di ni bdag gi gzugs yin no snyam du sems pa 'di ni /

analyzed: de lta bas na skyon mang po du ma 'bras bu med pa'i 'dod bum zhog chung ba mthong nas dge slong de 'dod pa thams cad la kun tu rtog par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, seeing that the pot of desire is a small thing that has many faults and no results, the monk does not form thoughts about any of the desires.

original: yang dge slong de 'dod pa me 'bar ba lta bur mthong ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong de 'dod pa me 'bar ba lta bur mthong ste /

analyzed: ji ltar mar me mthong na dga' la rag na mchog tu tsha ba la /
translated: Just as a lamp is delightful to look at but is extremely hot to the touch,

original: phye ma leb rmongs pa mar me kha dog sdug par mthong nas mar me de'i nang du song ba dang / de 'chi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gis bsgribs pa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo phye ma leb lta bu dag ni 'dod pa thams cad la kun tu dga' bar lta'o //
analyzed: phye ma leb rmongs pa mar me kha dog sdug par mthong nas mar me de'i nang du song ba dang / de 'chi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gis bsgribs pa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo phye ma leb lta bu dag ni 'dod pa thams cad la kun tu dga' bar lta'o //
translated: Just as a moth, out of delusion, sees the beautiful color of a flame and flies into it, and then dies, in the same way, childish ordinary beings, obscured by desire, hatred, and delusion, see all desires as delightful, like moths.

original: mar me lta bu zhes bya ba ni gal te mar me der lus song ba'i phye ma leb bzhin du sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags rnams su sreg par 'gyur te /

translated: As for the example of the flame, if a sentient being were to enter into a flame, like a moth, he would be burned in the hells, as an animal, or as a hungry ghost.

original: de lta bas na 'dod pa dag gis chog go snyam nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dod pa dag gis chog go snyam nas /

analyzed: dge slong de 'dod pa dag las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //

original: lha'i mig gis brtags na /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis brtags na /

original: kham gyi zas gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: yid la byed pa'i zas yod pa de dag mthong ste /

analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bsam gtan gyi zas so //

analyzed: reg pa'i zas ni bya dang / mig gis lta ba dag gi'o //

translated: Another aspect of this is that all the childish ordinary beings of the desire realm, humans, hungry ghosts, animals, and hell beings are attached to the contact of sexual intercourse.

original: gang 'dod pa la bsten pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa la bsten pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams su 'byung ngo //

analyzed: de lta bas na 'jig rten 'di ni gnyis kyis bcings te /

translated: One is not free from attachment to all the bonds and latent tendencies.üîΩWith regard to forms that are objects of eye consciousness,

analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis mig gis yang dag @258b pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ste /
translated: one sees with the eye in a way that accords with reality.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba gang yin pa de las bde bar 'gyur ba dang / dmigs pa bde ba la rnam par smin pa mi bde ba'i las byung ba de'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ngo //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba gang yin pa de las bde bar 'gyur ba dang / dmigs pa bde ba la rnam par smin pa mi bde ba'i las byung ba de'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ngo //
translated: He sees as it really is the action that arises from the contact of the eye, which is the cause of pleasure, and the object of pleasure, which is the cause of unpleasant karmic ripening.

original: de bzhin du mig gi rnam par rig par bya ba yid mi bde bar 'gyur ba'i gnas gang yin pa de mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal rnam par smin pa bde ba las byung ba de'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rabüîΩtu shes so //

translated: Similarly, he knows as it really is the unpleasant mental state that arises from the contact of the eye, and the pleasant karmic ripening that arises from the contact of the eye, which is the cause of suffering.

original: mig gi rnam par rig par bya ba de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par rig par bya ba de gang yin zhe na /

original: gzugs la dmigs pa bde ba ni rnam par smin pa mi bde ba yin te /

analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i rnam par smin pa bde ba la bde'o zhes rab tu shes shing /

original: rtog par byed la ro myong bar byed do //
analyzed: rtog par byed la ro myong bar byed do //
translated: He conceptualizes and savors it.

original: yongs su 'gyur bas rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang; yi dvags dang / dud 'gror yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
